abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission accused the bank of doling out three internships to appease officials at a Middle Eastern sovereign wealth fund.
snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission accused the bank of doling out three internships to appease officials at a Middle Eastern sovereign wealth fund.
lead_paragraph: The three interns at Bank of New York Mellon who joined the firm in the summer of 2010 seemed unusual choices on paper. None met the financial giant’s rigorous criteria, and none were hired through the usual internship programs.

headline.main: Bank of New York Mellon Settles Bribery Case Over Interns
headline.print_headline: Bank of New York Mellon Settles Bribery Case Over Interns

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bank of New York Mellon Corporation

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
